intro: Petamenes schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, with a dense, rounded canopy. The bark is thick and fissured, and the leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate. Its flowers are unisexual and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant produces a milky latex when injured, which is a characteristic feature of many species in this family.
